title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Celtics face a challenging 2025-26 season after losing key players to trades and free agency.
Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury sidelines him for potentially the entire season, affecting team prospects.
Derrick White discusses adapting to changes, with new players and roles, aiming to remain competitive.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police closed an investigation into a report of a masked man attempting to grab an 11-year-old boy.
Police Chief Julie Flaherty stated the investigation found insufficient evidence to pursue the case further.
The investigation included interviews and surveillance footage review, leading to the determination that the report was unfounded.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica is charged with assault involving a hatchet and a civil rights violation in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly threatened pro-Palestinian protesters with a hatchet during a rally and used a car to assault a participant.
The Middlesex County DA added a civil rights violation charge against Freeman over the August 10 incident at Harvard Square.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' rookie left tackle Will Campbell was limited in practice due to an ankle injury before the season opener.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez has not practiced since July 28 due to a hamstring injury and is expected to miss Sunday's game.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore participated in limited practice, while the Patriots prepare to face Raiders' pass rusher Maxx Crosby.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed is causing a strong rotten egg-like odor at Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester.
The seaweed, dasysiphonia japonica, was washed ashore by Hurricane Erin and is decomposing, creating the smell.
This species spread to the East Coast in 2008 and is now found from Nova Scotia to Long Island.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM at Eastern Bank on Mishawaun Road in Woburn was damaged by an explosive device, police report.
FBI and State Police Bomb Squad responded to the scene after the early morning explosion on Thursday.
The suspect responsible for the explosion remains at large, and authorities assure no current public safety threat.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Caterson, 35, was found shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street and died in the hospital.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearms violation and will be arraigned in Roxbury Municipal Court.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: New England governors, including Maura Healey, urge Trump administration to support offshore wind projects despite federal opposition.
A lawsuit against Trump's executive order halting new offshore wind leasing was filed by several states including Massachusetts.
New Hampshire Gov. Kelly Ayotte signed a law ending the state's offshore wind development mandate, diverging from regional support.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty, 56, was shot and killed in Shrewsbury after walking his son to Calvin Coolidge Elementary School.
Suspect Snehal A. Srivastava allegedly shot Doherty during a graffiti incident on a bridge near Jordan Pond.
A vigil and fundraiser for Doherty will be held on October 11 at SAC Park in Shrewsbury.

title: Ryan Clark says that Tom Brady was not a ‘generational talent’ at quarterback
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Ryan Clark stated Tom Brady is not a 'generational talent' despite his extensive NFL achievements.
Clark's remarks on ESPN's 'First Take' included similar views on Drew Brees and Peyton Manning.
Clark recognizes John Elway and Patrick Mahomes as generational talents, sparking debate with Stephen A. Smith and Dan Orlovsky.
